Proverbs.1: a bird that flies off the earth and lands on an anthill is still on the ground
Proverbs.2: only a fool tests the depth of a river with no feet
Proverbs.3: examine what is said, not who is speaking
Proverbs.4: if you want to know the end, look at the beginning
Proverbs.5: knowledge is a garden if it isn't cultivated, you can't harvest it
Proverbs.6: a roaring lion kills no game
Proverbs.7: do not look where you feel look where you slipped
Proverbs.8: restless feet might walk you into a snake pit
Proverbs.9: no shortcuts exist to the top of a palm tree
Proverbs.10: when two elephants fight, it is the grass that gets hurt
Proverbs.11: tomorrow belongs to people who prepare for it today
Proverbs.12: no medicine exists that can cure hatred
Proverbs.13: all monkeys cannot hang from the same branch
Proverbs.14: he who digs a grave for his enemy might as well be digging one for himself
Proverbs.15: even the lion protects himself against flies
Proverbs.16: however long the night, the dawn will break
Proverbs.17: if you heal the leg of a person, do not be surprised if they use it to run away
Proverbs.18: the axe forgets but the tree remembers
Proverbs.19: once you carry your own water, you'll remember every drop
Proverbs.20: don't set sail on someone else's star
Proverbs.21: to try and to fail is not laziness
Proverbs.22: seeing is different than being told
Proverbs.23: no matter how beautiful and well crafted a coffin might look, it will not make anyone wish for death
Proverbs.24: wood already touched by fire is not hard to set alight
Proverbs.25: confiding a secret to an unworthy person is like carrying grain in a bag with a hole
Proverbs.26: a feeble effort will not fulfill the self
Proverbs.27: having a good discussion is like having riches
Proverbs.28: don't think there are no crocodiles just because the water is calm
Proverbs.29: he who refuses to obey cannot command
Proverbs.30: do not call a dog with a whip in your hand
Proverbs.31: one falsehood spoils a thousand truths
Proverbs.32: the earth is a beehive, we all enter by the same door
Proverbs.33: rain does not fall on one roof alone
Proverbs.34: however far a stream flows, it doesn't forget its origin
Proverbs.35: if you think you're too small to make a difference, try spending the night with a mosquito
Proverbs.36: if there is no enemy within, the enemy outside can do no harm
Proverbs.37: the eye never forgets what the heart has seen
Proverbs.38: no person is born great great people become great when others are sleeping
Proverbs.39: when an old man dies, a library is burned with him
Proverbs.40: truth should be in love and love in truth
Proverbs.41: when you marry a monkey for his wealth, the money goes but the monkey remains
Proverbs.42: where there is love, there is no darkness
Proverbs.43: it is better to be loved than to be feared
Proverbs.44: when one is in love, a cliff becomes a meadow
Proverbs.45: he who loves, loves you with your dirt
Proverbs.46: if love is a sickness, patience is the remedy
Proverbs.47: to love someone who doesn't love you is like shaking a tree to make the dew drops fall
Proverbs.48: if the full moon loves you, why worry about the stars?
Proverbs.49: don't be so in love that you can't tell when it's raining
Proverbs.50: even as the archer loves the arrow that flies, so too he loves the bow that remains constant in his hands
Proverbs.51: love, like rain, does not choose the grass on which it falls
Proverbs.52: do not treat your loved one like a swinging door: you are fond of it but you push it back and forth
Proverbs.54: one who loves the vase, loves also what is inside
Proverbs.55: one who marries for love alone will have bad days but good nights
Proverbs.56: love for something makes a man blind and deaf
Proverbs.57: let your love be like the misty rain, coming softly but flooding the river
Proverbs.58: the quarrel of lovers is the renewal of love
Proverbs.59: don't try to make someone hate the person he loves for he will go on loving but he will hate you
Proverbs.60: if a woman doesn't love you, she calls you brother
Proverbs.61: love is a despot who spares no one
Proverbs.62: love doesn't rely on physical features
Proverbs.63: if anyone makes you laugh, it is not always because they love you
Proverbs.64: you know who you love but you can't know who loves you
Proverbs.66: a happy man marries the girl he loves; a happier man loves the girl he married
Proverbs.67: one who plants grapes by the roadside, and one who marries a pretty woman, share the same problem
Proverbs.68: if money were to be found up in the trees, most people would be married to monkeys
Proverbs.69: every kind of love is love, but self-love is supreme among them
Proverbs.70: true love means what's mine is yours
Proverbs.71: it's better to fall from a tree and break your back than to fall in love and break your heart
Proverbs.72: he may say that he loves you, wait and see what he does for you
Proverbs.73: it is difficult for two long-nosed lovers to kiss
Proverbs.74: a fish and bird may fall in love but the two cannot build a home together
Proverbs.75: lovers do not hide their nakedness
Proverbs.76: when one is in love, a mountain top becomes a flat field
Proverbs.78: wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it
Proverbs.79: the fool speaks, the wise man listens
Proverbs.81: the heart of the wise man lies quiet like limpid water
Proverbs.82: wisdom is like fire people take it from others
Proverbs.83: only a wise person can solve a difficult problem
Proverbs.84: knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand
Proverbs.85: in the moment of crisis, the wise build bridges, and the foolish build dams
Proverbs.86: if you are filled with pride, then you will have no room for wisdom
Proverbs.87: a wise person will always find a way
Proverbs.89: a man who uses force is afraid of reasoning
Proverbs.90: wisdom is not like money to be tied up and hidden
Proverbs.91: one who causes others misfortune also teaches them wisdom
Proverbs.92: a fool cannot untie the knot tied by a wise man
Proverbs.93: knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand
Proverbs.95: one day in the life of a wise man is worth a fool's entire life
Proverbs.96: to get lost is to learn the way
Proverbs.97: other people's wisdom prevents the king from being called a fool
Proverbs.98: by the time the fool has learned the game, the players have dispersed
Proverbs.99: if you close your eyes to facts, you will learn through accidents
Proverbs.100: the wise create proverbs for fools to learn, not to repeat
Proverbs.101: just because the lizard nods his head, doesn't mean he's in agreement
Proverbs.102: a wise man fills his head before emptying his mouth
Proverbs.103: if you think education is expensive, try ignorance
Proverbs.104: your body is a temple of knowledge
Proverbs.105: a fool has to say something a wise person has something to say
Proverbs.106: the wise man never takes a step too long for his leg
Proverbs.107: give advice, if people don't listen let adversity teach them
Proverbs.108: a man's ruin lies in his tongue
Proverbs.109: no man can outwit their ancestors
Proverbs.110: it is better to live as a lion for one day rather than years as a sheep
Proverbs.111: when deed speaks, words are nothing
Proverbs.112: he who does not know one thing knows another
Proverbs.113: a wise person doesn't fall down the same hill twice
Proverbs.114: a family is like a forest, when you are outside it is dense, when you are inside you see that each tree has its place
Proverbs.115: a united family eats from the same plate
Proverbs.116: a family tie is like a tree, it can bend but it cannot break
Proverbs.117: if i am in harmony with my family, that's success
Proverbs.118: where there are many, nothing goes wrong
Proverbs.119: a child is what you put into him
Proverbs.120: when you show the child the moon, it sees only your finger
Proverbs.121: we desire to bequeath two things to our children; the first one is roots, the other one is wings
Proverbs.122: a real family eats from the same cornmeal
Proverbs.123: even the maid has a family
Proverbs.124: don't meddle with a family feud
Proverbs.125: in a family if you have somebody who is troublesome it's the family members who are more worried than the troublesome member
Proverbs.126: if you educate a man, you educate one person if you educate a woman, you educate a whole family
Proverbs.127: a husband with a good wife will never be on the road without supplies
Proverbs.128: a home without a woman is like a barn without cattle
Proverbs.129: parents give birth to the body of their children, but not always to their characters
Proverbs.130: every beetle is a gazelle in the eyes of its mother
Proverbs.131: a mother cannot give birth to something bigger than herself
Proverbs.132: it takes a village to raise a child
Proverbs.133: a small house will hold a hundred friends
Proverbs.134: a woman is a flower in a garden; her husband is the fence around it
Proverbs.135: the mother hen does not break its own eggs
Proverbs.136: if you want to go fast, go alone if you want to go far, go together
Proverbs.137: sticks in a bundle are unbreakable
Proverbs.138: brothers love each other when they are equally rich
Proverbs.139: dine with a stranger but save your love for your family
Proverbs.140: there is no fool who is disowned by his family
Proverbs.141: if relatives help each other, what evil can hurt them?
Proverbs.142: he who earns calamity, eats it with his family
Proverbs.143: the old woman looks after the child to grow its teeth and the young one in turn looks after the old woman when she loses her teeth
Proverbs.144: when brothers fight to the death, a stranger inherits their father's estate
Proverbs.145: children are the reward of life
Proverbs.146: home affairs are not talked about on the public square
Proverbs.147: a child does not laugh at the ugliness of his mother
Proverbs.148: family must look out for family
Proverbs.149: it is hard to cure madness that originates in the family
Proverbs.150: when a bitter woman takes over the house, the family she rules is doomed
Proverbs.151: a bird will always use another bird's feathers to feather its own nest
Proverbs.152: a person is a person because of other persons
Proverbs.153: a man's grave is by the roadside
Proverbs.154: he that digs up a grave for his enemy, may be digging it for himself
Proverbs.155: a bad name is like a stigma
Proverbs.156: by the time the fool has learned the game, the players have dispersed
Proverbs.157: do not call the forest that shelters you a jungle
Proverbs.158: even though the old man is strong and hearty, he will not live forever
Proverbs.159: fire and gunpowder do not sleep together
Proverbs.160: hunger is felt by a slave and hunger is felt by a king
Proverbs.161: if you are in hiding, don't light a fire
Proverbs.162: it is mr. old-man-monkey who marries mrs. old-woman-monkey
Proverbs.163: it is no shame at all to work for money
Proverbs.164: it is the calm and silent water that drowns a man
Proverbs.165: it is the fool's sheep that break loose twice
Proverbs.166: it's a bad child who does not take advice
Proverbs.167: money is sharper than a sword
Proverbs.168: no one tests the depth of a river with both feet
Proverbs.169: one cannot both feast and become rich
Proverbs.170: one falsehood spoils a thousand truths
Proverbs.171: only when you have crossed the river, can you say the crocodile has a lump on his snout
Proverbs.172: rain beats a leopard's skin, but it does not wash out the spots
Proverbs.173: the moon moves slowly, but it crosses the town
Proverbs.174: the poor man and the rich man do not play together
Proverbs.175: the ruin of a nation begins in the homes of its people
Proverbs.176: there is no medicine to cure hatred
Proverbs.177: two small antelopes can beat a big one
Proverbs.178: what is bad luck for one man is good luck for another
Proverbs.179: when a king has good counselors, his reign is peaceful
Proverbs.180: when a man is coming toward you, you need not say: 'come here'
Proverbs.181: when a man is wealthy, he may wear an old cloth
Proverbs.182: when a woman is hungry, she says, 'roast something for the children that they might eat'
Proverbs.183: when the cock is drunk, he forgets about the hawk
Proverbs.184: when the fool is told a proverb, its meaning has to be explained to him
Proverbs.185: when you are rich, you are hated; when you are poor, you are despised
Proverbs.186: when you follow in the path of your father, you learn to walk like him
Proverbs.187: wood already touched by fire is not hard to set alight
Proverbs.188: a chick that will grow into a cock can be spotted the very day it hatches
Proverbs.189: a child's fingers are not scalded by a piece of hot yam which his mother puts into his palm
Proverbs.190: an old woman is always uneasy when dry bones are mentioned in a proverb
Proverbs.191: a man who pays respect to the great paves the way for his own greatness
Proverbs.192: a proud heart can survive a general failure because such a failure does not prick its pride
Proverbs.193: as the dog said, 'if i fall down for you and you fall down for me, it is playing'
Proverbs.194: a wise man who knows proverbs, reconciles difficulties (yoruba)
Proverbs.195: do not look where you fell, but where you slipped
Proverbs.196: if a child washes his hands he could eat with kings
Proverbs.197: if you don't stand for something, you will fall for something
Proverbs.198: it takes a whole village to raise a child
Proverbs.199: looking at a king's mouth one would never think he sucked his mother's breast
Proverbs.200: people should not talk while they are eating or pepper may go down the wrong way
Proverbs.201: the lizard that jumped from the high iroko tree to the ground said he would praise himself if no one else did
Proverbs.202: the mouth which eats does not talk
Proverbs.203: the sun will shine on those who stand before it shines on those who kneel under them
Proverbs.204: those whose palm-kernels were cracked for them by a benevolent spirit should not forget to be humble
Proverbs.205: when a man says yes, his chi (personal god) says yes also
Proverbs.206: when the moon is shining the cripple becomes hungry for a walk
Proverbs.207: you can tell a ripe corn by its look
Proverbs.208: you must judge a man by the work of his hands
Proverbs.209: slow, slow is the way to go/slowness is the better locomotion
Proverbs.210: being steady and keen is important when performing given tasks hurry, hurry, has no blessings
Proverbs.212: the remedy for fire is fire
Proverbs.217: intelligence is an asset. knowledge can be used to better ones life
Proverbs.218: little by little fills up the measure
Proverbs.219: a great journey is begun by a single mile
Proverbs.221: the child of a snake is a snake
Proverbs.223: one falsehood spoils a thousand truths

Meanings.1: It is good to stay humble and remember your origins
Meanings.2: You can tell someone is a fool by their actions
Meanings.3: Pay attention to what people do not what they say
Meanings.4: Success is determined by how you start
Meanings.5: To gain knowledge, one must consistently study
Meanings.6: You cannot gain anything by sitting around talking about it. You must get up and work for it.
Meanings.7: Look for the cause of a problem and not the symptoms
Meanings.8: It is easy for a person to get into trouble when he or she is not busy doing something.
Meanings.9: If we want to reach the top of our respective goals, we will need to put in the work
Meanings.10: When powerful forces go to war, it's their people who are hurt. Those who never asked for the conflict in the first place are caught, and killed, in the crossfire.
Meanings.11: Our actions in the present determine if we achieve our goals in the future
Meanings.12: Hatred is a complex and powerful emotion that can be incredle to overcome
Meanings.13: Something good will come out of a difficult situation
Meanings.14: Someone that plans harm or misfortune for others may also inadvertently be the recipient of that same misfortune.
Meanings.15: Always be on your guard and do not let yourself be taken advantage of by anyone or anything.
Meanings.16: No matter how difficult or dark the current circumstances may seem, there is always the promise of a better future ahead.
Meanings.17: Even when we help others, they may not always be grateful and may take advantage of our kindness
Meanings.18: A person hurt in a situation remembers, whereas the person who hurt the other, forgets.
Meanings.19: Experiences in life deepen our appreciation for things we often overlook.
Meanings.20: Just because someone has been successful at doing something does not mean you will be successful at doing the same thing.
Meanings.21: Don't be discouraged when you fail, as long as you are. doing something. Use failure as a driving force to push. you forward.
Meanings.22: Don't mistake hearsay from the truth.
Meanings.23: Material possessions are not as important as life itself.
Meanings.24: With the right preparatory work and conditions, a difficult task can become much easier.
Meanings.25: It is important to choose trustworthy friends.
Meanings.27: Engaging in meaningful conversations and exchanging ideas can be as valuable as wealth or material riches.
Meanings.28: Always be aware of your surroundings and different situations.
Meanings.29: A good leader should first learn how to follow orders in order to be successful.
Meanings.30: Approach things with a calm and open mindset.
Meanings.31: No matter what the situation, it's always better to tell the truth.
Meanings.32: Regardless of our differences, we all share a common origin and destiny.
Meanings.33: Trouble comes to everyone at one point or another.
Meanings.34: Always remember your roots and respect your traditions no matter where you are.
Meanings.35: Even the most seemingly insignificant beings can make quite a difference to someone.
Meanings.36: Our greatest enemy is often ourselves.
Meanings.37: The experiences that deeply affect us emotionally are remembered vividly and lastingly.
Meanings.38: Greatness is earned through effort, not inherited at birth.
Meanings.39: When an elder passes away, valuable knowledge is lost forever.
Meanings.40: Genuine love and truth are intertwined and inseparable.
Meanings.41: Marrying for wealth may lead to loss, but the undesirable traits remain.
Meanings.43: Being loved brings greater happiness than being feared.
Meanings.45: True love accepts imperfections without judgment.
Meanings.46: Patience is the cure for love's challenges.
Meanings.47: Unrequited love is futile and unrewarding.
Meanings.48: Focus on the love you have, not on what you lack.
Meanings.49: Love remains steadfast even amid change.
Meanings.50: Love is indiscriminate and falls where it may.
Meanings.51: Treat your loved ones with respect and consistency.
Meanings.52: Love is deaf to gossip and hears only the truth.
Meanings.53: True love values both the container and its contents.
Meanings.54: If someone loves or appreciates something superficial, they also value what is deeper or more meaningful.
Meanings.55: Marrying for love alone may bring challenges during the day, but intimacy and connection at night.
Meanings.56: When someone is deeply attached or infatuated with something, they may overlook its faults or fail to hear criticism.
Meanings.57: Love should be gentle and gradual but have a powerful and transformative effect over time.
Meanings.58: Disagreements and conflicts between lovers can ultimately strengthen their relationship by resolving issues and fostering understanding.
Meanings.59: Trying to turn someone against the person they love will only create resentment towards you, not diminish their love for the other person.
Meanings.60: If a woman doesn't have romantic feelings for a man, she may consider him only as a friend or brother.
Meanings.61: Love can be powerful and controlling, affecting everyone regardless of their status or position.
Meanings.62: Love is not dependent on physical appearance; it goes beyond superficial features.
Meanings.63: If someone makes you laugh, it doesn't necessarily mean they love you; laughter can have various motivations.
Meanings.64: While you may know who you love, it's difficult to know who loves you in return.
Meanings.65: Love can provide comfort and relief from pain.
Meanings.66: Finding happiness in the person you marry brings greater fulfillment than simply marrying someone you love.
Meanings.67: Pursuing superficial things can lead to common problems and challenges.
Meanings.68: Many people prioritize wealth over other qualities when choosing a partner.
Meanings.69: While various forms of love exist, self-love is the most important.
Meanings.70: True love involves sharing and sacrifice.
Meanings.71: The pain of a broken heart can be worse than physical injury.
Meanings.72: Actions speak louder than words when it comes to demonstrating love.
Meanings.73: Sometimes, physical differences can complicate expressions of love.
Meanings.74: Love doesn't hide vulnerabilities or flaws.
Meanings.75: Love can change one's perception of the world, making challenges seem less daunting.
Meanings.76: Wisdom is valuable and can lead to success.
Meanings.77: Wisdom is vast and cannot be fully grasped by one individual.
Meanings.78: A wise person listens more than they speak.
Meanings.79: Wisdom is acquired over time through experience and reflection.
Meanings.80: Wise individuals are calm and tranquil.
Meanings.81: Wisdom is shared and spread among people.
Meanings.83: Knowledge without understanding or insight is worthless.
Meanings.84: In times of crisis, wise individuals find solutions, while fools create further problems.
Meanings.85: Pride can hinder the acquisition of wisdom.
Meanings.86: Wise individuals find solutions to challenges.
Meanings.87: Wisdom is not innate; it's acquired through learning and experience.
Meanings.88: A single day of wise decisions can surpass a lifetime of foolishness.
Meanings.89: Mistakes can be valuable learning experiences.
Meanings.90: The wisdom of others can prevent foolishness.
Meanings.91: By the time a fool learns, others may have moved on.
Meanings.92: Ignoring facts can lead to unintended consequences.
Meanings.93: Proverbs are designed to impart wisdom to those who listen.
Meanings.94: Actions don't always indicate agreement or consent.
Meanings.95: Wise individuals think before they speak.
Meanings.96: Ignorance can be more costly than education.
Meanings.97: Your body is a vessel for learning and growth.
Meanings.98: A wise person speaks thoughtfully, whereas a fool speaks impulsively.
Meanings.99: Wise individuals plan carefully to avoid unnecessary risks.
Meanings.100: Adversity can be a powerful teacher.
Meanings.101: Words can bring about destruction if spoken carelessly.
Meanings.103: It's better to take decisive action than to hesitate.
Meanings.104: Deeds are more meaningful than words alone.
Meanings.105: People have different areas of expertise and knowledge.
Meanings.106: Wise individuals learn from their mistakes and don't repeat them.
Meanings.108: Unity within a family is essential for its strength.
Meanings.109: Family bonds are resilient but can be flexible.
Meanings.110: Harmony within the family is a measure of success.
Meanings.111: Cooperation among many leads to success.
Meanings.112: Children's development is influenced by their upbringing.
Meanings.113: Children often imitate what they see.
Meanings.114: Parents aim to provide their children with roots (foundation) and wings (opportunities).
Meanings.115: Family members share resources and experiences.
Meanings.116: Even those in servitude have familial ties.
Meanings.117: Interfering in family disputes can be risky.
Meanings.118: Family members are often more concerned about troublesome relatives than the individuals themselves.
Meanings.119: Educating women benefits entire families and communities.
Meanings.120: A good spouse contributes to the well-being of the family.
Meanings.121: Women play a vital role in the household.
Meanings.122: Parental influence extends beyond physical attributes.
Meanings.123: Every mother sees her child as special.
Meanings.124: Community support is essential in raising children.
Meanings.125: Even a small space can accommodate many friends.
Meanings.126: A husband protects and cherishes his wife.
Meanings.127: Parents prioritize the well-being of their offspring.
Meanings.128: Collaboration leads to greater achievements than working alone.
Meanings.129: Solidarity among people makes them stronger.
Meanings.130: Brothers often share a special bond when they are equally successful.
Meanings.131: While it's fine to dine with strangers, familial love should be preserved.
Meanings.132: Disownment from one's family is a rare occurrence.
Meanings.133: Mutual assistance among relatives can mitigate external challenges.
Meanings.135: The elderly care for the young, and vice versa, in a cycle of support.
Meanings.136: Family disputes can lead to inheritance issues.
Meanings.137: Children are a source of joy and fulfillment.
Meanings.138: Private family matters should be kept within the household.
Meanings.139: Children respect their parents despite any flaws.
Meanings.140: Families should prioritize each other's well-being.
Meanings.141: Familial conflicts can be challenging to resolve.
Meanings.142: The ruler's actions can influence the entire nation.
Meanings.143: Humility is essential for maintaining relationships.
Meanings.144: Cooperation and collaboration lead to success.
Meanings.145: Learning from past mistakes is important for growth.
Meanings.146: Educating children is a communal effort.
Meanings.148: Mutual respect is crucial for peaceful coexistence.
Meanings.149: Proverbs contain wisdom that can resolve disputes.
Meanings.150: Judging by actions is more accurate than judging by words.
Meanings.151: Patience and steady progress lead to success.
Meanings.153: Responding to fire with fire can be effective.
Meanings.154: Retaliation in kind is a common response to offense.
Meanings.155: Individuals are shaped by their interactions with others.
Meanings.156: Collaboration and collective effort yield stronger results.
